intro: Tetranthera lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetranthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Tetranthera lancifolia is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the buckwheat family.
